intro: Erigeron major, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides, and it produces showy blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branching. Erigeron major is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
